poem:
### Scams Prevention Framework

At the break of dawn,  
laws like woven nets,  
cast across a digital sea—  
to ensnare the unseen  
where whispers masquerade as truth,  
the clink of coins  
echoes softer now.  
In the net's cradle,  
fragile trust grows firm.  
$50 million —  
a price for vigilance,  
banks and screens  
bound to watch.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Banks and social media companies to be fined over scams under new Australian laws touted as ‘strongest in world’ Companies could face fines of up to $50m for failing to prevent scams and may be forced to compensate victims under new laws the Albanese government says would give Australians the strongest anti-scammer protection in the world. The government will introduce legislation to federal parliament on Thursday to establish its long-awaited “scams prevention framework”. Under the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
